get.description:
Verify and read single OAID record. - `200 OK` - **OAID exists**, authorized field attributes are returned. - `403 FORBIDDEN`- **OAID exists**, but the owner does not allow access details. - `404 NOT FOUND` - OAID does NOT exist.
OAIDs not confirmed or already deleted will also return 404 NOT FOUND. - `422 UNPROCESSABLE ENTITY` - requested OAID does not have a valid format.
Check the OAID docs on https://docs.oaid.at to see valid patterns. #### Required scope: - **read**: Read-only access to ISP related content

get.description:
Verify and read customer site record. - `200 OK` - Customer Site exists and - if user is the _owner_ of the code - the full record will be returned.
If **confirmed** the record will include the additional attributes like _center_ and _attr_. - `403 FORBIDDEN`- Site exists, but the authenticated user is NOT the owner of the code. - `404 NOT FOUND` - given Site is correctly formatted, but Site does not exist (any more). - `422 UNPROCESSABLE ENTITY` - requested parameters are not compliant. #### Required scope: - **read**: Read-only access to ISP related content

usr.title: User Defined Code
usr.description:
A user-defined reference key.
Interpretation by third parties is generally not possible.

anyOf.title: ADRCD
anyOf.description:
Every address present in the Austrian AGWR (*Adress-, Gebäude- und Wohnungsregister*) is uniquely 
identifiable by an address code **ADRCD** (*Adresscode*).

*The AGWR defines a geographic coordinate for this object. This coordinate may differ 
from the coordinate of the customer site but is usually close to and on the same lot.*

anyOf.title: ADRCD with SUBCD
anyOf.description:
The 10-digit code, resulting from the combination of **ADRCD with SUBCD** (*address code* and *address subcode*), 
is referred to as the address number (*Adressnummer*) and uniquely identifies the building address.

*The AGWR defines a geographic coordinate for this object. This coordinate may differ 
from the coordinate of the customer site but is usually close to and on the same lot.*

anyOf.title: OBJNR
anyOf.description:
The 7-digit **OBJNR** (*Objektnummer*) is a unique, non-descriptive identification number 
for all buildings throughout Austria.

*The AGWR defines a geographic coordinate for this object. This coordinate may differ 
from the coordinate of the customer site but is usually close to and on the same lot.*

anyOf.title: OBJNR with NTZLNR
anyOf.description:
The 11-digit code resulting from the combination of **OBJNR with NTZLNR**
(*Objektnummer with Nutzungseinheitlaufnummer*) is referred to as the
unit key (*Einheitsschlüssel*) and identifies the usage unit within the building.

pac.title: PAC
pac.description:
The 9-digit code *Post Address Code* **PAC** represents a postal delivery address and is assigned by the Austrian Post.

*The PAC defines address fields and a geographic coordinate. Address fields may differ from the 
public register AGWR and coordinate may differ from the coordinate of the customer site.*

relation_name.title: Relation ANO-PIP Layer
relation_name.description:
*Business Relation* builds the relationship between an Active Network Operator (ANO)
and a Physical Infrastructure Provider (PIP).

OAID Register does not contain any content regarding the contract for this relationship.

center.title: Coordinates
center.description:
A String of WGS84 *Latitude,Longitude* in decimal WGS84 notation.  
Coordinates have to be within the allowed bounds.

node_type.title: Response without any geoinformation
node_type.description:
Due to a requirement from the Physical Infrastructure Provider, the response does not include
any geographical information or details that would allow for geographical localization (such 
as address, property, etc.). The available connection points (Customer Access Nodes) for this 
relation are also not shown on any overview maps.

relation_name.title: Relation ANO-PIP Layer
relation_name.description:
*Business Relation* builds the relationship between an Active Network Operator (ANO)
and a Physical Infrastructure Provider (PIP).

OAID Register does not contain any content regarding the contract for this relationship.

NodeTokenEnum.title: NodeTokenEnum
NodeTokenEnum.description:
Indicates fulfillment milestone of Customer Access Node.

`operation`: The operation phase of a fiber network begins when the customer site is
fully installed and ready for activation. At this stage, network monitoring, maintenance,
and troubleshooting processes ensure service reliability, while provisioning systems
allow rapid activation of internet service within a few days.

`construction`: The construction phase of a fiber network involves building the
physical infrastructure, including laying fiber optic cables, installing network
equipment, and connecting customer premises. This stage includes trenching,
pole mounting, splicing, and testing to ensure the network is ready for service.
Once complete, the site moves to the operation phase for final activation.


`planning`: The planning phase of a fiber network involves designing the network layout,
securing permits, and coordinating with stakeholders. Engineers map out fiber routes,
estimate costs, and schedule construction activities to ensure efficient deployment.
At this stage, the project can still be modified or stopped based on feasibility,
budget, or regulatory challenges.

OAIDVersion.title: OAIDVersion
OAIDVersion.description:
Version representing the length of the OAID code:

- V8 for 8-digit codes
- V6 for 6-digit codes (outdated)

relation_name.title: Relation ANO-PIP Layer
relation_name.description:
*Business Relation* builds the relationship between an Active Network Operator (ANO)
and a Physical Infrastructure Provider (PIP).

OAID Register does not contain any content regarding the contract for this relationship.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: Phone number for inquiries regarding objects in the OAID Register.

email_to.title: EMail Address
email_to.description: eMail-address for inquiries regarding objects in the OAID Register.

country.title: Country Code
country.description:
2-digit country code according [ISO 3166](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2).

"AT" is default if unset and the only value allowed.

zip.title: ZIP Code / Postal Code
zip.description:
Austrian postal code (postcode, ZIP) used within a postal address
for the purpose of sorting mail.

city.title: Name of municipality
city.description: Name of municipality or name of postal city.

street.title: Name of Street
street.description: Street name according to official register.

door.title: Door number
door.description: A door number, usually used in multi-dwelling buildings or offices.

addon.title: Addon to address
addon.description: A local description if other elements are not sufficient.

PostalAddress.title: PostalAddress
PostalAddress.description: Postal address elements to identify customer site.

SiteTokenEnum.title: SiteTokenEnum
SiteTokenEnum.description:
Indicates fulfillment milestone of Customer Site.

`operation`: The operation phase of a fiber network begins when the customer site is
fully installed and ready for activation. At this stage, network monitoring, maintenance,
and troubleshooting processes ensure service reliability, while provisioning systems
allow rapid activation of internet service within a few days.

`construction`: The construction phase of a fiber network involves building the
physical infrastructure, including laying fiber optic cables, installing network
equipment, and connecting customer premises. This stage includes trenching,
pole mounting, splicing, and testing to ensure the network is ready for service.
Once complete, the site moves to the operation phase for final activation.

oaid.title: Open Access ID
oaid.description: Open Access ID using 8- or 6-digit code.

*Business Relation* builds the relationship between an Active Network Operator (ANO)
and a Physical Infrastructure Provider (PIP).

OAID Register does not contain any content regarding the contract for this relationship.

lot_id.title: Lot Identifier (KG + Grundstücksnummer)
lot_id.description: A combination of cadastral identifier and the lot number. Read more details on Austrian lots here.

center.title: Coordinates
center.description:
A String of WGS84 *Latitude,Longitude*  decimal WGS84 notation.  
Coordinates have to be within the boundaries of Austria.

StatusCode.title: StatusCode
StatusCode.description:
The overall process instance status.

The status is used to control the process instance itself, whereas
the token represents the *position* of an instance within the process.

All valid and usable codes have status='active'.

Technology.title: Technology
Technology.description: Technology in use - for future use

TokenCode.title: TokenCode
TokenCode.description:
According to the request-confirm process the token may have one of the following values:

- **requested**\
a newly created OAID has token=requested. Next step is confirmation.
- **confirmed**\
a confirmed OAID is activated and can be actively used.
- **canceled**\
if OAID is no longer needed, the user may cancel it. A cancelled OAID can not be
activated anymore.
- (_deleted_)\
for superusers only, can mark OAIDs as deleted.

Those values represent the _position_ of the process instance within the process. In other
systems the term _status_ is used, whereas here the status reflects the overall process control
state. _token_ may best be interpreted as a reached **milestone** within the process.

tags.name: Introduction
tags.description:
Service to request, manage and operate human-readable codes across multiple domains.

Further information can be found in our [documentation][url_oaid_docs]. We will post new features in our [OAID blog][url_oaid_blog].

The codes are well suited for situations where multiple organizations (domains) need to interact or provide services with guaranteed unique identifiers. One such scenario is the establishment and resourcing of optical networks, as described in the white paper **Open Access Networks** by *VAT* ([Verband Alternativer Telekom-Netzbetreiber][url_vat]), *CMG* and **OFAA** (Austria, Sep. 2020).

While the codes can be used for any purpose with similar requirements, they are particularly well suited for *Open Access Identifiers* (OAID) and *Open Link Identifiers* (OLID), as mentioned in the paper.

The OAID initiative is driven by [**OFAA**][url_ofaa] (**Open Fiber Association Austria**).

OAID and the OAID Register API & application are based on the concepts and ideas from [correlate analytics gmbh][url_correlate] and implemented by [yio gmbh][url_yio].

### Key Features:

- supports **8-digit (40-bit)** and 6-digit (30-bit) code lengths
- guaranteed uniqueness
- well suited for any purpose where code length is of significance
- limited and verified character set to prevent misinterpretation and misspelling
- uniformly distributed to maximize the code distance
- easy to integrate in existing customer workflows with state-of-the-art interfaces
- equipped to support prefixes like countries or categories
- modular approach to extend functionalities with (e.g.) QRCodes, ...

#### API Features:

- OpenAPI 3.x compliant
- API is RESTful and built on HTTP over SSL
- Client independent - use your preferred HTTP/REST library of your language, there is no need to learn another third party library to use the service
- Modern authentication framework based on OAuth principles
- Clear and simple documentation - **Your feedback is always welcome**
- Customer and data driven development

_data driven solutions by [yio][url_yio], September 2020_


[url_correlate]: https://correlate.at
[url_yio]: https://yio.at
[url_oaid_docs]: https://docs.oaid.at
[url_oaid_blog]: https://docs.yio.at/blog/category/oaid/
[url_ofaa]: https://ofaa.at
[url_vat]: https://vat.at

tags.name: Access
tags.description:
Access is granted to authenticated and authorized users through a standard OAuth Credential Workflow. To obtain access, please contact hello@yio.at or your local reseller.

## Specs

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

A more detailed description for the authentication process can be found in our [general documentation](https://docs.yio.at/general/authentication/).

tags.name: OAID
tags.description:
Endpoints to verify, check for existence and read OAID records.

It is up to the OAID owner, most often the physical infrastructure provider (PIP), to enable access for OAIDs. If the 
response indicates a forbidden (403) or missing (404) OAID, but you are certain that this code is valid, we kindly ask you
to contact the owner directly and ask them to either confirm the OAID or grant access for ISPs.

Keep in mind that the endpoints for querying the codes should be used solely for verification of _known_ OAIDs. To suppress 
_OAID guessing_, the endpoints are rate limited. Please refrain from making excessive requests to the API.

tags.name: Coverage
tags.description:
Coverage services consist of endpoints to carry out a feasibility check and read contract features from a specified
relation ID.

tags.name: Relation
tags.description:
These endpoints enable the establishment and management of relationships between ANOs (Active Network Operators) and PIPs (Physical Infrastructure Providers). 
A relationship is uniquely identified by the 'relation_name'.

A list of the Austrian Regulatory Authority for Broadcasting and Telecommunications operators can be accessed via the "RTR Operators" endpoint.

tags.name: Management
tags.description: Contains endpoints to administrate API usage or check your bookings.

tags.name: Release Notes
tags.description:
All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.1.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

### [2.2.1] - 2025-02-24

#### Changed

- use of No-Offset pagination on list endpoints (sites, codes, ...) - **Breaking Change**
  
  (old pagination with _page and _size will be terminated in Q2)

- aligned milestone tokens for Customer Sites and
  Customer Access Nodes (wording is now _operation_ and _construction_)

#### Deprecated

- marked external_id as deprecated - if given, it will be used as customer_reference
 
#### Removed

- removed deprecated field *attr* from codes endpoint

### [2.1.x] - 2024-06-24

#### Added

- support for vector tiles on customer sites

#### Changed

- added partners to /pip/sites (allows to verify the partners an isp might see)
- changed address_reference in /pip/sites to be a complex object
  (supports various reference values now)


### [2.0.x] - 2024-05-26

#### Changed

- moved address_reference in /pip/sites to root and changed allowed namespace 'any' -> 'usr'


#### Fixed

- fixed query parameter issue on relations
- issue where server responded with error 500 instead of 422
- missing customer_reference for /pip/sites/ on create or update


### [2.0.x] - 2024-04-04

#### Added

- tenant contact information
- customer sites associated to OAID
- relations between PIP and ANOs
- public tile service

#### Changed

- migrated backend to latest framework packages

tags.name: License
tags.description:
The OAID Register is a service offered by [OFAA][ofaa] in cooperation with [yio gmbh][yio].


#### Disclaimer:

- yio gmbh ensures the uniqueness and security of all generated codes.
- Backup is in place for the codes themselves. Additional data provided by the user is not included in the backup.
- See terms and conditions for more details.
- API endpoints, attributes and structure are subject to change. It is up to the user to adapt to the interface.

**We always appreciate your feedback on the service.**


[yio]: https://yio.at
[ofaa]: https://ofaa.at
[hello]: mailto://hello@yio.at
[cc4]: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode.de
